trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Hudson
There were no other sightings in Hudson on or around July 4th 1986
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsmy wife, son, daughter and one of our neighbors children were returning home to roberts, wi from a fireworks display we had attended in st. paul, mn. as i started down the approach to the bridge which crosses the st. croix river into wi i noticed a bright light just above the bluff on the wi side. i drove this highway every day, as i worked in st. paul, but had never seen a light that bright there before. i nugged my wife and ask her if she had ever seen a light there before and she was as surpised as i was when she then spotted it. we were crossing the bridge now and when we were about 3\4 of the way across the light started to move from its position northeast of us, moving in a southwesterly direction. it was moving in a direction that would take it right over the top of us. by this time i was almost at a dead stop on the bridge. as it got close we were able to clearly see that it was a large craft, triangular in shape, not a sharply angled triangle, but rounded on the nose. the size appeared to be about the length of a dc10, and the width about the wingspan of a dc10 the lights from the bridge lit up the belly of the craft. it was metalic in color. my wife ask me what all those things on the belly were. instead of a simple smooth surface it had all kinds of structure on the belly, some like barrels, some like piping, and other unknown structure. the craft made absolutely no noise. it was moving at about 10 mph. it was approximately 250-300 feet above us. i feel pretty comfortable with the altitude as that is approximatly the hieght of the bluff it was hovered initially over. we watched it for about 20 seconds. i then took off for a wayside stop on the top of the bluff on the wi side. i pulled into the wayside, took out the binoculars i had with me, and watched the craft continue to travel on a strait line. it did not change altitude. on the rear of the craft i could see two red glows, not like lights. my impression is that they were some sort of propulsion. the did not emit any vapor or other material but appear to be pulsing. the craft just faded away in the dark. i would estimate that the total elapsed time from first spotting it to termination at about 10 minutes. all five of us saw the object. none of us had ever seen anything before that we thought was a ufo. this object was definately not an aircraft, not a blimp or ballon, or any kind of glider. i guess we all had a sense of bewelderment, knowing we had seen something that no of us could expain, yet knowing full well that we did see it and that it was real.
Summary: UFO Spotted low over Hudson, WI
